sentences.en: a dispassionate view of the situation
A journalist should be a dispassionate reporter of fact.
sentences.cn: 记者应当是对事实作冷静报导的人.

sentences.en: Calm, dispassionate discussions on how we could stay friends.
sentences.cn: 我们冷静地讨论着怎样保持朋友关系.

sentences.en: For dispassionate account of how the fight started, ask a neutral observer not a participant.
sentences.cn: 要想知道一场打斗引起的真实原因,去问一位不带偏见的目击人, 而不是问参与打斗的人.

sentences.en: Has anyone tried approaching the company with a dispassionate attitude?
sentences.cn: 没人试着以客观冷静的态度与自己搞交涉 吗 ?

sentences.en: Masterly I call it, and such it must appear to any dispassionate thinker.
sentences.cn: 我称之为高明, 相信任何不带偏见看问题的人肯定也会有此同感.

sentences.en: One should look at executive bonus with a slightly dispassionate approach.
sentences.cn: 大家应该稍微冷静冷静,理智看待高管奖金这事.

sentences.en: taking a calm, dispassionate view of the situation
sentences.cn: 以冷静、客观公正的观点看待形势

sentences.en: Try to keep your money talks as dispassionate as possible.
sentences.cn: 努力尽量冷静地保持你们的钱财对话.

sentences.en: We, as prosecutors, try to be dispassionate about the cases we bring.
sentences.cn: 作为检察官，我们对经手的案件会尽力做到不偏不倚。

sentences.en: You're actually talking about this stuff in a dispassionate way.
sentences.cn: 你竟然真的能冷静地讨论这个问题,这实在是太好了.

words.tran_cn: 不带感情的；平心静气的；公平的

trans.tran_cn: 不动情感的，平心静气的，公正的，不带偏见的
trans.tran_en: not influenced by personal emotions and therefore able to make fair decisions
